alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; De Baca County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA AND NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 359 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Mesa to 6 miles northwest of Roswell. Movement was northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge and Mesa. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 116 and 169. Highway 380 between Mile Markers 156 and 163. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; De Baca County
